user_input: How does the proposed integration of AI education in schools prepare students for Industry 4.0?
reference_contexts:
['Republic of the Philippines 
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES 
Quezon City, Metro Manila 
TWENTIETH CONGRESS 
First Regular Session 
HOUSE BILL NO. ______ 
Introduced by 
Rep. Robert Nazal 
AN ACT 
INSTITUTIONALIZING THE INTEGRATION OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
EDUCATION INTO THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM, 
PROVIDING FOR ITS IMPLEMENTATION, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES 
EXPLANATORY NOTE 
Artificial Intelligence (AI) has emerged as a transformative force in nearly every sector 
of modern life, from healthcare and finance to agriculture, logistics, and education. In 
the World Economic Forum’s Future of Jobs Report 2023, AI and machine learning 
specialists ranked among the fastest-growing occupations globally. In the Philippines, AI 
applications are increasingly integrated in business operations, and creative industries. 
Yet there remains a significant gap in foundational AI literacy among young Filipinos. 
Basic exposure to AI concepts and ethical frameworks during formative schooling years 
is vital to ensure that our graduates are not merely passive users of technology but 
informed, responsible, and innovative contributors to an increasingly digital world. 
Introducing AI education at the elementary and secondary levels will: 
1.​
Promote critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills through
practical and contextual learning;
2.​
Equip students with an understanding of algorithms, data, and responsible AI
practices;
3.​
Foster a culture of innovation and scientific curiosity essential to national
development; and
4.​
Prepare the future workforce for the demands of Industry 4.0 and the
emerging knowledge economy.
The 
Department 
of 
Education 
has 
successfully 
integrated Information and 
Communications Technology (ICT) into the K to 12 curriculum over the past decade. 
Building on this foundation, this measure proposes to institutionalize AI literacy in all 
elementary and high schools nationwide. Under the bill, DepEd will develop 
July 21, 2025
3:54 pm
2186']
reference: The proposed integration of AI education in schools aims to prepare students for Industry 4.0 by promoting critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills through practical and contextual learning. It also equips students with an understanding of algorithms, data, and responsible AI practices, fostering a culture of innovation and scientific curiosity essential to national development.

user_input: How does the Department of Science and Technology contribute to AI education initiatives?
reference_contexts:
['age-appropriate curriculum modules in consultation with the Department of Science and 
Technology, the Department of Information and Communications Technology, and other 
partners. Teacher capacity-building will be central to this initiative, complemented by 
investments in infrastructure, open-access learning resources, and training programs. 
International experience demonstrates that early AI education can bridge digital divides, 
reduce technology anxieties, and spark interest in careers in science and technology. 
Countries such as Singapore, China, the United States, and the United Kingdom have 
already begun introducing AI lessons as early as primary school. If we are to remain 
competitive and inclusive in our development, the Philippines must likewise act with 
urgency. 
The passage of this bill will empower the next generation of Filipinos with the 
knowledge, skills, and ethical grounding to shape AI in ways that advance national 
progress and uphold our shared values. 
In view of the foregoing, the immediate enactment of this measure is earnestly sought. 
Rep. ROBERT NAZAL 
Representative']
reference: The Department of Science and Technology collaborates in the development of age-appropriate curriculum modules, which are central to the initiative aimed at enhancing teacher capacity-building and providing necessary resources for early AI education.

user_input: What is the significance of Quezon City in the context of AI education initiatives?
reference_contexts:
['Republic of the Philippines 
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES 
Quezon City, Metro Manila 
TWENTIETH CONGRESS 
First Regular Session 
HOUSE BILL NO. ______ 
Introduced by 
Rep. Robert Nazal 
AN ACT 
INSTITUTIONALIZING THE INTEGRATION OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
EDUCATION INTO THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM, 
PROVIDING FOR ITS IMPLEMENTATION, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES 
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in 
Congress assembled: 
SEC. 1. TITLE.  
This Act shall be known as the “Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025.” 
SEC. 2. DECLARATION OF POLICY.  
It is the policy of the State to promote scientific and technological literacy, innovation, 
and competitiveness among Filipino learners. Recognizing the transformative impact of 
Artificial Intelligence (AI) in all sectors of society, the State shall ensure that students are 
equipped with foundational knowledge and skills in AI, ethics, and responsible use of 
emerging technologies, thereby preparing them for the future of work and active 
participation in the digital economy. 
SEC. 3. STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVES.  
This Act shall have the following objectives: 
A.​
To integrate basic concepts, applications, and ethical considerations of Artificial
Intelligence in the K to 12 curriculum;
B.​
To build capacity among teachers and school administrators to deliver AI
education effectively;
2186']
reference: Quezon City is the location where the House of Representatives of the Philippines introduced the 'Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025,' which aims to institutionalize the integration of AI education into the elementary and secondary curriculum.

user_input: How does the Commission on Higher Education contribute to the integration of AI education in the Philippine basic education system?
reference_contexts:
["C.​
To foster creativity, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills among students 
through exposure to AI tools and projects; 
 
D.​
To promote inclusive access to AI education, especially in public schools and 
underserved communities; and 
 
E.​
To establish partnerships with academic institutions, industry, and international 
organizations to enhance curriculum content and teacher training. 
 
SEC. 4. SCOPE AND COVERAGE.  
 
The integration of AI education shall cover all public and private elementary and 
secondary schools nationwide. The curriculum shall be age-appropriate and 
contextualized to different grade levels and learner capacities. 
 
SEC. 5. CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT.  
 
The Department of Education (DepEd), in coordination with the Department of Science 
and Technology (DOST), the Commission on Higher Education (CHED), the 
Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT), and relevant 
stakeholders, shall ensure the effective and meaningful introduction of Artificial 
Intelligence (AI) education in the Philippine basic education system. In this regard, the 
following shall be undertaken: 
 
A.​
Curriculum and Instructional Materials Development. - DepEd shall formulate 
comprehensive curriculum guides, lesson plans, teaching strategies, and learning 
resources on AI concepts and applications that are suitable for learners from 
Grades 4 to 12. These materials shall be tailored to the learners' age, cognitive 
level, and capacity to understand basic to intermediate AI topics. The development 
of such resources must be completed within two (2) years from the date this Act 
takes effect. 
 
B.​
Regular Review and Updating. - The AI curriculum and related learning materials 
shall be regularly reviewed and updated to keep pace with rapid technological 
advancements in the field of AI. This ensures that students are learning the most 
current concepts, tools, and best practices used in real-world AI environments. 
 
C.​
Integration of Ethics and Responsible AI Use. - Modules and lessons shall include 
key topics such as data privacy, responsible data use, algorithmic fairness, and 
ethical considerations in the development and deployment of AI technologies. 
These lessons will aim to instill in learners a strong sense of social responsibility 
and awareness of the potential risks and impacts of AI on individuals, 
communities, and society. 
 
D.​
Pilot Implementation. - Before full-scale implementation, the AI curriculum shall be 
pilot-tested in selected schools to evaluate its effectiveness, appropriateness, and"]
reference: The Commission on Higher Education (CHED) collaborates with the Department of Education (DepEd), the Department of Science and Technology (DOST), the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT), and relevant stakeholders to ensure the effective and meaningful introduction of Artificial Intelligence (AI) education in the Philippine basic education system. This includes formulating comprehensive curriculum guides, lesson plans, teaching strategies, and learning resources on AI concepts and applications suitable for learners from Grades 4 to 12, as well as ensuring regular review and updating of the AI curriculum to keep pace with technological advancements.

user_input: Wht is the role of DepEd in teacher training for AI?
reference_contexts:
['relevance. Feedback gathered from these pilot schools—especially from teachers, 
students, and parents—shall be used to make necessary improvements and 
refinements to the curriculum. 
 
SEC. 6. TEACHER TRAINING AND CAPACITY-BUILDING.  
 
DepEd shall design and implement a continuous professional development program for 
teachers, including: 
 
A.​
Training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools; 
 
B.​
Pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction; 
 
C.​
Certification programs in collaboration with academic institutions and industry 
partners; and 
 
D.​
Provision of teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support. 
 
SEC. 7. LEARNING RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  
 
To facilitate effective teaching and learning of AI, DepEd, in collaboration with DICT and 
DOST, shall: 
 
A.​
Ensure availability of computers, internet connectivity, and software in all schools; 
B.​
Develop an open-access online repository of AI learning materials; and 
C.​
Provide technical assistance to schools in resource-limited settings. 
 
SEC. 8. INCLUSION OF AI AWARENESS IN EARLY GRADES.  
 
DepEd shall introduce age-appropriate content on AI awareness and digital literacy for 
Grades 1 to 3 to build foundational understanding of technology and responsible digital 
citizenship. These lessons shall focus on helping children understand, in simple terms, 
how technology is used in everyday life and the importance of using digital tools safely 
and responsibly.  
 
SEC. 9. PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION.  
 
DepEd is authorized to enter into memoranda of agreement with private sector entities, 
international organizations, professional associations, and higher education institutions 
to: 
 
A.​
Support curriculum enhancement and teacher training; 
B.​
Promote student competitions, camps, and innovation challenges in AI; and 
C.​
Facilitate donations of equipment and software.']
reference: DepEd shall design and implement a continuous professional development program for teachers, which includes training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools, as well as pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction. Additionally, DepEd will collaborate with academic institutions and industry partners to offer certification programs and provide teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support.

user_input: What is the role of Congress in the implementation of AI education programs?
reference_contexts:
['SEC. 10. MONITORING AND EVALUATION.  
 
DepEd shall establish a monitoring and evaluation framework to assess the 
implementation and impact of AI education programs, including learning outcomes and 
teacher readiness, and submit an annual report to Congress. 
 
SEC. 11. INCENTIVES.  
 
Schools that demonstrate exemplary performance in integrating AI into their curriculum 
shall be eligible to receive recognition, grants, and other forms of support as may be 
determined by the Department of Education (DepEd), including, but not limited to, 
financial grants to enhance AI learning facilities and procure necessary equipment, and 
access to training programs for teachers and administrators. DepEd may also facilitate 
technical assistance or partnerships with academic and industry experts to support 
these schools in further developing their AI education programs.  
 
SEC. 12. APPROPRIATIONS.  
 
The funds necessary to carry out the initial implementation of this Act shall be charged 
against the respective budget of concerned agencies for the current year. Thereafter, 
such amount as may be necessary for the continued implementation shall be included 
in the annual General Appropriations Act. 
 
SEC. 13. IMPLEMENTING RULES AND REGULATIONS.  
 
The Department of Education, in consultation with concerned agencies, shall 
promulgate the implementing rules and regulations of this Act within ninety (90) days 
upon its effectivity. 
 
SEC. 14. REPEALING CLAUSE.  
 
All laws, decrees, executive issuances, rules, and regulations inconsistent with this Act 
are hereby repealed or modified accordingly. 
 
SEC. 15. SEPARABILITY CLAUSE.  
 
If any provision of this Act is declared invalid or unconstitutional, the remaining 
provisions shall remain in full force and effect. 
 
SEC. 16. EFFECTIVITY CLAUSE.  
 
This Act shall take effect fifteen days after its publication in the Official Gazette or in a 
newspaper of general circulation. 
 
Approved,']
reference: Congress is involved in the oversight of AI education programs through the requirement for the Department of Education (DepEd) to submit an annual report to Congress assessing the implementation and impact of these programs.

user_input: Who is PIA S. CAYETANO?
reference_contexts:
["TWENTIETH CONGRESS OF THE 
REPUBLIC OF THE PHILIPPINES 
First Regular Session
25 ,JUL-2 P4 55
SENATE
S. No.
25
Introduced by Senator PIA S. CAYETANO
AN ACT
REGULATING THE DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
SYSTEMS IN THE PHILIPPINES, PROMOTING ETHICAL AND RESPONSIBLE 
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE INNOVATION, AND INTEGRATING 
SUSTAINABILITY AND FUTURES THINKING IN NATIONAL POLICY MAKING, 
AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
EXPLANATORY NOTE
The rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is profoundly transforming industries, 
governance systems, and societies worldwide. As the Phiiippines continues its digital 
transformation journey, there is an urgent need for a nationai framework that ensures 
the safe, responsibie, and ethical use of AI, aligned with our vision of an inclusive, 
innovative, and secure digital future.
The European Union's landmark AI Act of 2024, the world's first comprehensive 
legal framework on AI, highlights the importance of risk-based classification, 
transparency, accountability, and human oversight.1 In the same way, the United Nations 
Secretary-General's High-Level Advisory Body on AI emphasizes the need for coordinated 
global governance to uphold rights-based, transparent, and inclusive AI development.2 
These international efforts reflect a growing giobal recognition. While AI holds vast 
economic and societai potential, it must be accompanied by a robust regulatory legal 
framework.
1 European Union AI Act. (2024). World's First Comprehensive AI Law 
https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/european-approach-artificial-intelligence 
2CD0 Magazine. (2024). UN advisory body's 7 key recommendations for global AI governance. 
https://www.cdomagazine.tech/aiml/un-advisory-bodys-7-key-recommendations-for-global-ai- 
governance?utm"]
reference: PIA S. CAYETANO is a Senator in the Philippines who introduced an act regulating the development and use of artificial intelligence systems in the country, promoting ethical and responsible AI innovation.

user_input: What ethical considerations are involved in the implementation of AI education programs as outlined by the Department of Education?
reference_contexts:
['<1-hop>

SEC. 10. MONITORING AND EVALUATION.  
 
DepEd shall establish a monitoring and evaluation framework to assess the 
implementation and impact of AI education programs, including learning outcomes and 
teacher readiness, and submit an annual report to Congress. 
 
SEC. 11. INCENTIVES.  
 
Schools that demonstrate exemplary performance in integrating AI into their curriculum 
shall be eligible to receive recognition, grants, and other forms of support as may be 
determined by the Department of Education (DepEd), including, but not limited to, 
financial grants to enhance AI learning facilities and procure necessary equipment, and 
access to training programs for teachers and administrators. DepEd may also facilitate 
technical assistance or partnerships with academic and industry experts to support 
these schools in further developing their AI education programs.  
 
SEC. 12. APPROPRIATIONS.  
 
The funds necessary to carry out the initial implementation of this Act shall be charged 
against the respective budget of concerned agencies for the current year. Thereafter, 
such amount as may be necessary for the continued implementation shall be included 
in the annual General Appropriations Act. 
 
SEC. 13. IMPLEMENTING RULES AND REGULATIONS.  
 
The Department of Education, in consultation with concerned agencies, shall 
promulgate the implementing rules and regulations of this Act within ninety (90) days 
upon its effectivity. 
 
SEC. 14. REPEALING CLAUSE.  
 
All laws, decrees, executive issuances, rules, and regulations inconsistent with this Act 
are hereby repealed or modified accordingly. 
 
SEC. 15. SEPARABILITY CLAUSE.  
 
If any provision of this Act is declared invalid or unconstitutional, the remaining 
provisions shall remain in full force and effect. 
 
SEC. 16. EFFECTIVITY CLAUSE.  
 
This Act shall take effect fifteen days after its publication in the Official Gazette or in a 
newspaper of general circulation. 
 
Approved,', '<2-hop>

teachers, including: 
 
A.​
Training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools; 
 
B.​
Pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction; 
 
C.​
Certification programs in collaboration with academic institutions and industry 
partners; and 
 
D.​
Provision of teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support. 
 
SEC. 7. LEARNING RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  
 
To facilitate effective teaching and learning of AI, DepEd, in collaboration with DICT and 
DOST, shall: 
 
A.​
Ensure availability of computers, internet connectivity, and software in all schools; 
B.​
Develop an open-access online repository of AI learning materials; and 
C.​
Provide technical assistance to schools in resource-limited settings. 
 
SEC. 8. INCLUSION OF AI AWARENESS IN EARLY GRADES.  
 
DepEd shall introduce age-appropriate content on AI awareness and digital literacy for 
Grades 1 to 3 to build foundational understanding of technology and responsible digital 
citizenship. These lessons shall focus on helping children understand, in simple terms, 
how technology is used in everyday life and the importance of using digital tools safely 
and responsibly.  
 
SEC. 9. PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION.  
 
DepEd is authorized to enter into memoranda of agreement with private sector entities, 
international organizations, professional associations, and higher education institutions 
to: 
 
A.​
Support curriculum enhancement and teacher training; 
B.​
Promote student competitions, camps, and innovation challenges in AI; and 
C.​
Facilitate donations of equipment and software.', "<2-hop>

TWENTIETH CONGRESS OF THE 
REPUBLIC OF THE PHILIPPINES 
First Regular Session
25 ,JUL-2 P4 55
SENATE
S. No.
25
Introduced by Senator PIA S. CAYETANO
AN ACT
REGULATING THE DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
SYSTEMS IN THE PHILIPPINES, PROMOTING ETHICAL AND RESPONSIBLE 
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE INNOVATION, AND INTEGRATING 
SUSTAINABILITY AND FUTURES THINKING IN NATIONAL POLICY MAKING, 
AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
EXPLANATORY NOTE
The rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is profoundly transforming industries, 
governance systems, and societies worldwide. As the Phiiippines continues its digital 
transformation journey, there is an urgent need for a nationai framework that ensures 
the safe, responsibie, and ethical use of AI, aligned with our vision of an inclusive, 
innovative, and secure digital future.
The European Union's landmark AI Act of 2024, the world's first comprehensive 
legal framework on AI, highlights the importance of risk-based classification, 
transparency, accountability, and human oversight.1 In the same way, the United Nations 
Secretary-General's High-Level Advisory Body on AI emphasizes the need for coordinated 
global governance to uphold rights-based, transparent, and inclusive AI development.2 
These international efforts reflect a growing giobal recognition. While AI holds vast 
economic and societai potential, it must be accompanied by a robust regulatory legal 
framework.
1 European Union AI Act. (2024). World's First Comprehensive AI Law 
https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/european-approach-artificial-intelligence 
2CD0 Magazine. (2024). UN advisory body's 7 key recommendations for global AI governance. 
https://www.cdomagazine.tech/aiml/un-advisory-bodys-7-key-recommendations-for-global-ai- 
governance?utm"]
reference: The teacher training program is designed to include training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools, which are essential for understanding ethical AI. This continuous professional development program aims to equip teachers with pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction, ensuring that they can teach students about the responsible and ethical use of AI technologies.

user_input: How does the Artificial Intelligence Regulation Act (AIRA) aim to foster creativity and critical thinking skills among students through AI education initiatives?
reference_contexts:
['<1-hop>

TWENTIETH CONGRESS OF THE 
REPUBLIC OF THE PHILIPPINES 
First Regular Session
)
SENATE 
S. No. 2.ci
25 JUL-2 P4:56
n;-' :
Introduced by Senator PIA S. CAYETANO
AN ACT
REGULATING THE DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
SYSTEMS IN THE PHILIPPINES, PROMOTING ETHICAL AND RESPONSIBLE 
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE INNOVATION, AND INTEGRATING 
SUSTAINABILITY AND FUTURES THINKING IN NATIONAL POLICY MAKING, 
AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in 
Congress assembled:
1 
Section 1. Short Title. - This Act shall be known as the 'Artificial Intelligence
2 
Regulation Act (AIRA)."
3 
Sec. 2. Declaration of Policy. - It is the policy of the State to recognize that
4 
science and technology are essential for national development and progress. The State
5 
shall give priority to research and development, invention, innovation, and their
6 
utilization; and to science and technology education, training, and services.1 In this
7 
regard, the State shall promote the responsible development and use of Artificial
8 
Intelligence (AI) to advance inclusive growth, public service delivery, innovation, and
9 
long-term national resilience. It shall likewise institutionalize futures thinking and
10 
sustainability as core principles in education, governance, and innovation. Towards
11 
this end, the State shall advance AI in a manner that is ethical, inclusive, transparent,
12 
and accountable.
13 
Sec. 3. Objectives. - The objectives of this Act are the following:
1 Article XIV, Section 10 of the Philippine Constitution', "<2-hop>

C.​
To foster creativity, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills among students 
through exposure to AI tools and projects; 
 
D.​
To promote inclusive access to AI education, especially in public schools and 
underserved communities; and 
 
E.​
To establish partnerships with academic institutions, industry, and international 
organizations to enhance curriculum content and teacher training. 
 
SEC. 4. SCOPE AND COVERAGE.  
 
The integration of AI education shall cover all public and private elementary and 
secondary schools nationwide. The curriculum shall be age-appropriate and 
contextualized to different grade levels and learner capacities. 
 
SEC. 5. CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT.  
 
The Department of Education (DepEd), in coordination with the Department of Science 
and Technology (DOST), the Commission on Higher Education (CHED), the 
Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT), and relevant 
stakeholders, shall ensure the effective and meaningful introduction of Artificial 
Intelligence (AI) education in the Philippine basic education system. In this regard, the 
following shall be undertaken: 
 
A.​
Curriculum and Instructional Materials Development. - DepEd shall formulate 
comprehensive curriculum guides, lesson plans, teaching strategies, and learning 
resources on AI concepts and applications that are suitable for learners from 
Grades 4 to 12. These materials shall be tailored to the learners' age, cognitive 
level, and capacity to understand basic to intermediate AI topics. The development 
of such resources must be completed within two (2) years from the date this Act 
takes effect. 
 
B.​
Regular Review and Updating. - The AI curriculum and related learning materials 
shall be regularly reviewed and updated to keep pace with rapid technological 
advancements in the field of AI. This ensures that students are learning the most 
current concepts, tools, and best practices used in real-world AI environments. 
 
C.​
Integration of Ethics and Responsible AI Use. - Modules and lessons shall include 
key topics such as data privacy, responsible data use, algorithmic fairness, and 
ethical considerations in the development and deployment of AI technologies. 
These lessons will aim to instill in learners a strong sense of social responsibility 
and awareness of the potential risks and impacts of AI on individuals, 
communities, and society. 
 
D.​
Pilot Implementation. - Before full-scale implementation, the AI curriculum shall be 
pilot-tested in selected schools to evaluate its effectiveness, appropriateness, and"]
reference: The Artificial Intelligence Regulation Act (AIRA) aims to foster creativity, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills among students by promoting exposure to AI tools and projects. It emphasizes the importance of integrating AI education in both public and private schools, ensuring that the curriculum is age-appropriate and contextualized for different grade levels. The Act also encourages partnerships with academic institutions and industry to enhance curriculum content and teacher training, thereby supporting the development of these essential skills in students.

user_input: What are the objectives of the Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025, and how does it involve the Department of Science and Technology in its implementation?
reference_contexts:
['<1-hop>

Republic of the Philippines 
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES 
Quezon City, Metro Manila 
TWENTIETH CONGRESS 
First Regular Session 
HOUSE BILL NO. ______ 
Introduced by 
Rep. Robert Nazal 
AN ACT 
INSTITUTIONALIZING THE INTEGRATION OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
EDUCATION INTO THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM, 
PROVIDING FOR ITS IMPLEMENTATION, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES 
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in 
Congress assembled: 
SEC. 1. TITLE.  
This Act shall be known as the “Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025.” 
SEC. 2. DECLARATION OF POLICY.  
It is the policy of the State to promote scientific and technological literacy, innovation, 
and competitiveness among Filipino learners. Recognizing the transformative impact of 
Artificial Intelligence (AI) in all sectors of society, the State shall ensure that students are 
equipped with foundational knowledge and skills in AI, ethics, and responsible use of 
emerging technologies, thereby preparing them for the future of work and active 
participation in the digital economy. 
SEC. 3. STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVES.  
This Act shall have the following objectives: 
A.​
To integrate basic concepts, applications, and ethical considerations of Artificial
Intelligence in the K to 12 curriculum;
B.​
To build capacity among teachers and school administrators to deliver AI
education effectively;
2186', '<2-hop>

age-appropriate curriculum modules in consultation with the Department of Science and 
Technology, the Department of Information and Communications Technology, and other 
partners. Teacher capacity-building will be central to this initiative, complemented by 
investments in infrastructure, open-access learning resources, and training programs. 
International experience demonstrates that early AI education can bridge digital divides, 
reduce technology anxieties, and spark interest in careers in science and technology. 
Countries such as Singapore, China, the United States, and the United Kingdom have 
already begun introducing AI lessons as early as primary school. If we are to remain 
competitive and inclusive in our development, the Philippines must likewise act with 
urgency. 
The passage of this bill will empower the next generation of Filipinos with the 
knowledge, skills, and ethical grounding to shape AI in ways that advance national 
progress and uphold our shared values. 
In view of the foregoing, the immediate enactment of this measure is earnestly sought. 
Rep. ROBERT NAZAL 
Representative']
reference: The objectives of the Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025 include integrating basic concepts, applications, and ethical considerations of Artificial Intelligence into the K to 12 curriculum, as well as building capacity among teachers and school administrators to deliver AI education effectively. The implementation of age-appropriate curriculum modules will be done in consultation with the Department of Science and Technology, along with the Department of Information and Communications Technology and other partners. This collaborative approach aims to ensure that students are equipped with foundational knowledge and skills in AI, ethics, and responsible use of emerging technologies.

user_input: What is the purpose of the bill introduced by Rep. Robert Nazal regarding AI education, and how does it plan to implement this in schools?
reference_contexts:
['<1-hop>

Republic of the Philippines 
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES 
Quezon City, Metro Manila 
TWENTIETH CONGRESS 
First Regular Session 
HOUSE BILL NO. ______ 
Introduced by 
Rep. Robert Nazal 
AN ACT 
INSTITUTIONALIZING THE INTEGRATION OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
EDUCATION INTO THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM, 
PROVIDING FOR ITS IMPLEMENTATION, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES 
EXPLANATORY NOTE 
Artificial Intelligence (AI) has emerged as a transformative force in nearly every sector 
of modern life, from healthcare and finance to agriculture, logistics, and education. In 
the World Economic Forum’s Future of Jobs Report 2023, AI and machine learning 
specialists ranked among the fastest-growing occupations globally. In the Philippines, AI 
applications are increasingly integrated in business operations, and creative industries. 
Yet there remains a significant gap in foundational AI literacy among young Filipinos. 
Basic exposure to AI concepts and ethical frameworks during formative schooling years 
is vital to ensure that our graduates are not merely passive users of technology but 
informed, responsible, and innovative contributors to an increasingly digital world. 
Introducing AI education at the elementary and secondary levels will: 
1.​
Promote critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills through
practical and contextual learning;
2.​
Equip students with an understanding of algorithms, data, and responsible AI
practices;
3.​
Foster a culture of innovation and scientific curiosity essential to national
development; and
4.​
Prepare the future workforce for the demands of Industry 4.0 and the
emerging knowledge economy.
The 
Department 
of 
Education 
has 
successfully 
integrated Information and 
Communications Technology (ICT) into the K to 12 curriculum over the past decade. 
Building on this foundation, this measure proposes to institutionalize AI literacy in all 
elementary and high schools nationwide. Under the bill, DepEd will develop 
July 21, 2025
3:54 pm
2186', '<2-hop>

age-appropriate curriculum modules in consultation with the Department of Science and 
Technology, the Department of Information and Communications Technology, and other 
partners. Teacher capacity-building will be central to this initiative, complemented by 
investments in infrastructure, open-access learning resources, and training programs. 
International experience demonstrates that early AI education can bridge digital divides, 
reduce technology anxieties, and spark interest in careers in science and technology. 
Countries such as Singapore, China, the United States, and the United Kingdom have 
already begun introducing AI lessons as early as primary school. If we are to remain 
competitive and inclusive in our development, the Philippines must likewise act with 
urgency. 
The passage of this bill will empower the next generation of Filipinos with the 
knowledge, skills, and ethical grounding to shape AI in ways that advance national 
progress and uphold our shared values. 
In view of the foregoing, the immediate enactment of this measure is earnestly sought. 
Rep. ROBERT NAZAL 
Representative']
reference: The bill introduced by Rep. Robert Nazal aims to institutionalize the integration of artificial intelligence education into the elementary and secondary curriculum in the Philippines. Its purpose is to address the significant gap in foundational AI literacy among young Filipinos, ensuring that graduates are informed, responsible, and innovative contributors to a digital world. The implementation plan includes developing age-appropriate curriculum modules in consultation with various departments, focusing on teacher capacity-building, and investing in infrastructure and training programs. This initiative is designed to promote critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills, preparing students for the demands of Industry 4.0 and the emerging knowledge economy.

SEC. 6. TEACHER TRAINING AND CAPACITY-BUILDING.  
 
DepEd shall design and implement a continuous professional development program for 
teachers, including: 
 
A.​
Training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools; 
 
B.​
Pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction; 
 
C.​
Certification programs in collaboration with academic institutions and industry 
partners; and 
 
D.​
Provision of teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support. 
 
SEC. 7. LEARNING RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  
 
To facilitate effective teaching and learning of AI, DepEd, in collaboration with DICT and 
DOST, shall: 
 
A.​
Ensure availability of computers, internet connectivity, and software in all schools; 
B.​
Develop an open-access online repository of AI learning materials; and 
C.​
Provide technical assistance to schools in resource-limited settings. 
 
SEC. 8. INCLUSION OF AI AWARENESS IN EARLY GRADES.  
 
DepEd shall introduce age-appropriate content on AI awareness and digital literacy for 
Grades 1 to 3 to build foundational understanding of technology and responsible digital 
citizenship. These lessons shall focus on helping children understand, in simple terms, 
how technology is used in everyday life and the importance of using digital tools safely 
and responsibly.  
 
SEC. 9. PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION.  
 
DepEd is authorized to enter into memoranda of agreement with private sector entities, 
international organizations, professional associations, and higher education institutions 
to: 
 
A.​
Support curriculum enhancement and teacher training; 
B.​
Promote student competitions, camps, and innovation challenges in AI; and 
C.​

reference: The collaboration between DepEd and DICT enhances teacher training and AI curriculum development by ensuring that teachers receive continuous professional development programs that include training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools. This partnership also facilitates the provision of teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support. Furthermore, it supports curriculum enhancement and promotes student competitions, camps, and innovation challenges in AI, thereby fostering a comprehensive educational framework for effective AI instruction.

user_input: What measures does DepEd plan to implement for teacher training and capacity-building in AI, and how will these be monitored and evaluated for effectiveness?
reference_contexts:
['<1-hop>

relevance. Feedback gathered from these pilot schools—especially from teachers, 
students, and parents—shall be used to make necessary improvements and 
refinements to the curriculum. 
 
SEC. 6. TEACHER TRAINING AND CAPACITY-BUILDING.  
 
DepEd shall design and implement a continuous professional development program for 
teachers, including: 
 
A.​
Training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools; 
 
B.​
Pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction; 
 
C.​
Certification programs in collaboration with academic institutions and industry 
partners; and 
 
D.​
Provision of teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support. 
 
SEC. 7. LEARNING RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  
 
To facilitate effective teaching and learning of AI, DepEd, in collaboration with DICT and 
DOST, shall: 
 
A.​
Ensure availability of computers, internet connectivity, and software in all schools; 
B.​
Develop an open-access online repository of AI learning materials; and 
C.​
Provide technical assistance to schools in resource-limited settings. 
 
SEC. 8. INCLUSION OF AI AWARENESS IN EARLY GRADES.  
 
DepEd shall introduce age-appropriate content on AI awareness and digital literacy for 
Grades 1 to 3 to build foundational understanding of technology and responsible digital 
citizenship. These lessons shall focus on helping children understand, in simple terms, 
how technology is used in everyday life and the importance of using digital tools safely 
and responsibly.  
 
SEC. 9. PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION.  
 
DepEd is authorized to enter into memoranda of agreement with private sector entities, 
international organizations, professional associations, and higher education institutions 
to: 
 
A.​
Support curriculum enhancement and teacher training; 
B.​
Promote student competitions, camps, and innovation challenges in AI; and 
C.​
Facilitate donations of equipment and software.', '<2-hop>

SEC. 10. MONITORING AND EVALUATION.  
 
DepEd shall establish a monitoring and evaluation framework to assess the 
implementation and impact of AI education programs, including learning outcomes and 
teacher readiness, and submit an annual report to Congress. 
 
SEC. 11. INCENTIVES.  
 
Schools that demonstrate exemplary performance in integrating AI into their curriculum 
shall be eligible to receive recognition, grants, and other forms of support as may be 
determined by the Department of Education (DepEd), including, but not limited to, 
financial grants to enhance AI learning facilities and procure necessary equipment, and 
access to training programs for teachers and administrators. DepEd may also facilitate 
technical assistance or partnerships with academic and industry experts to support 
these schools in further developing their AI education programs.  
 
SEC. 12. APPROPRIATIONS.  
 
The funds necessary to carry out the initial implementation of this Act shall be charged 
against the respective budget of concerned agencies for the current year. Thereafter, 
such amount as may be necessary for the continued implementation shall be included 
in the annual General Appropriations Act. 
 
SEC. 13. IMPLEMENTING RULES AND REGULATIONS.  
 
The Department of Education, in consultation with concerned agencies, shall 
promulgate the implementing rules and regulations of this Act within ninety (90) days 
upon its effectivity. 
 
SEC. 14. REPEALING CLAUSE.  
 
All laws, decrees, executive issuances, rules, and regulations inconsistent with this Act 
are hereby repealed or modified accordingly. 
 
SEC. 15. SEPARABILITY CLAUSE.  
 
If any provision of this Act is declared invalid or unconstitutional, the remaining 
provisions shall remain in full force and effect. 
 
SEC. 16. EFFECTIVITY CLAUSE.  
 
This Act shall take effect fifteen days after its publication in the Official Gazette or in a 
newspaper of general circulation. 
 
Approved,']
reference: DepEd plans to implement a continuous professional development program for teachers that includes training in basic AI concepts, programming fundamentals, and AI tools, as well as pedagogical strategies for effective AI instruction. Additionally, certification programs will be developed in collaboration with academic institutions and industry partners, and teaching resources, reference materials, and technical support will be provided. To monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of these AI education programs, DepEd will establish a framework to assess implementation and impact, including learning outcomes and teacher readiness, and will submit an annual report to Congress.

reference: The NAIC has several responsibilities regarding AI systems, including having original and exclusive jurisdiction over all matters pertaining to AI, such as its development, promotion, registration, and regulation. They are empowered to issue advisory opinions on AI systems that pose unacceptable risks to human rights, public safety, democratic integrity, or environmental sustainability. Additionally, the NAIC is tasked with creating an online portal for the public to access registered AI systems, submit complaints, and report harms. They also audit, inspect, or suspend AI systems that are not registered or violate the provisions of the Act. Furthermore, the NAIC is responsible for establishing and maintaining the National Registry of AI Systems, ensuring that no AI system is imported, sold, deployed, or publicly accessed in the Philippines without prior registration and compliance with applicable regulatory and ethical standards.

secondary schools nationwide. The curriculum shall be age-appropriate and

SEC. 5. CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT.  
 
The Department of Education (DepEd), in coordination with the Department of Science 
and Technology (DOST), the Commission on Higher Education (CHED), the 
Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT), and relevant 
stakeholders, shall ensure the effective and meaningful introduction of Artificial 
Intelligence (AI) education in the Philippine basic education system. In this regard, the 
following shall be undertaken: 
 
A.​
Curriculum and Instructional Materials Development. - DepEd shall formulate 
comprehensive curriculum guides, lesson plans, teaching strategies, and learning 
resources on AI concepts and applications that are suitable for learners from 
Grades 4 to 12. These materials shall be tailored to the learners' age, cognitive 
level, and capacity to understand basic to intermediate AI topics. The development 
of such resources must be completed within two (2) years from the date this Act 
takes effect. 
 
B.​
Regular Review and Updating. - The AI curriculum and related learning materials 
shall be regularly reviewed and updated to keep pace with rapid technological 
advancements in the field of AI. This ensures that students are learning the most 
current concepts, tools, and best practices used in real-world AI environments. 
 
C.​
Integration of Ethics and Responsible AI Use. - Modules and lessons shall include 
key topics such as data privacy, responsible data use, algorithmic fairness, and 
ethical considerations in the development and deployment of AI technologies. 
These lessons will aim to instill in learners a strong sense of social responsibility 
and awareness of the potential risks and impacts of AI on individuals, 
communities, and society. 
 
D.​
Pilot Implementation. - Before full-scale implementation, the AI curriculum shall be 
pilot-tested in selected schools to evaluate its effectiveness, appropriateness, and"]
reference: The Department of Education (DepEd) plans to implement several measures to ensure effective AI education in public schools. These include establishing a monitoring and evaluation framework to assess the impact of AI education programs, providing incentives for schools that excel in integrating AI into their curriculum, and developing comprehensive curriculum guides and instructional materials tailored for students from Grades 4 to 12. Additionally, DepEd will promote inclusive access to AI education, especially in underserved communities, and will establish partnerships with academic institutions and industry experts to enhance curriculum content and teacher training.

reference: The Department of Science and Technology (DOST) plays a crucial role in the integration of AI education in public schools by coordinating with the Department of Education (DepEd) and other relevant stakeholders to ensure the effective introduction of AI concepts and applications in the curriculum. This integration aims to foster creativity, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills among students, especially in underserved communities. Additionally, the National AI Commission, established as a policy-making body attached to the DOST, is responsible for overseeing the ethical and responsible deployment of AI technologies, which aligns with the educational initiatives to promote responsible AI use and awareness among students.

Republic of the Philippines 
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES 
Quezon City, Metro Manila 
TWENTIETH CONGRESS 
First Regular Session 
HOUSE BILL NO. ______ 
Introduced by 
Rep. Robert Nazal 
AN ACT 
INSTITUTIONALIZING THE INTEGRATION OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
EDUCATION INTO THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM, 
PROVIDING FOR ITS IMPLEMENTATION, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES 
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in 
Congress assembled: 
SEC. 1. TITLE.  
This Act shall be known as the “Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025.” 
SEC. 2. DECLARATION OF POLICY.  
It is the policy of the State to promote scientific and technological literacy, innovation, 
and competitiveness among Filipino learners. Recognizing the transformative impact of 
Artificial Intelligence (AI) in all sectors of society, the State shall ensure that students are 
equipped with foundational knowledge and skills in AI, ethics, and responsible use of 
emerging technologies, thereby preparing them for the future of work and active 
participation in the digital economy. 
SEC. 3. STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVES.  
This Act shall have the following objectives: 
A.​
To integrate basic concepts, applications, and ethical considerations of Artificial
Intelligence in the K to 12 curriculum;
B.​
To build capacity among teachers and school administrators to deliver AI
education effectively;
2186']
reference: The proposed Artificial Intelligence Education Act of 2025 aims to enhance the educational landscape for Filipino learners by integrating basic concepts, applications, and ethical considerations of Artificial Intelligence into the K to 12 curriculum. This initiative is part of a broader policy to promote scientific and technological literacy, innovation, and competitiveness among students. The Act recognizes the transformative impact of AI across all sectors and seeks to equip students with foundational knowledge and skills in AI, ethics, and responsible use of emerging technologies. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of building capacity among teachers and school administrators to effectively deliver AI education, thereby preparing Filipino learners for the future of work and active participation in the digital economy.
